title: User Authentication Success
description: Verify that a user can successfully log in with valid credentials and access protected routes.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Input valid username/email and password.
Click on the login button.
Verify that the user is redirected to the protected area/dashboard.
Verify that protected routes are accessible.

title: User Authentication Failure with Invalid Credentials
description: Verify that login fails with incorrect username/email or password and the user remains on the login page with an error message.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Input invalid username/email or password.
Click on the login button.
Verify that login fails with an appropriate error message.
Verify that the user stays on the login page and protected routes are not accessible.

title: Password Recovery Flow
description: Verify that the password recovery process allows a user to reset their password and login successfully.

steps.description: Navigate to the password recovery page.
Enter a registered email address.
Submit the recovery request.
Verify that a password recovery email is sent.
Use the link in the email to set a new password.
Attempt login with the new password.
Verify that login succeeds with the new password.

title: Product Catalog Listing and Filtering
description: Verify that products and tickets are listed correctly in the catalog and filters for categories and attributes work as expected.

steps.description: Navigate to the product catalog page.
Verify that products and tickets are displayed with correct basic information.
Apply category filters (e.g., tickets, clothing).
Verify that the list updates to show only filtered category items.
Use search input to find a product by name or keyword.
Verify that search results match the query.
Select a product/ticket to view details.
Verify that detailed view shows all product/ticket attributes correctly.

title: Add and Remove Items in Cart
description: Verify that users can add products and tickets to the cart, change quantities, and remove items dynamically.

steps.description: From the catalog, add multiple products and tickets to the cart.
Verify that all added items appear in the cart with correct details.
Change the quantity of an item in the cart.
Verify that the quantity updates accordingly and total prices adjust.
Remove an item from the cart.
Verify that the removed item no longer appears in the cart and totals update.

title: Complete Checkout with Multiple Participants
description: Verify that the checkout process collects customer and multiple participant information, accepts terms, additional notes, and shows accurate order summary.

steps.description: Proceed to checkout with items in cart.
Fill in customer personal information.
Add multiple participants with required details.
Verify that participant data is validated correctly.
Review and accept terms and conditions.
Add optional additional notes.
Verify that order summary reflects all inputs accurately (items, participants, pricing, notes).

title: Payment Processing via AbacatePay with QR Code Pix
description: Verify that a payment generates a QR Code Pix and waits for confirmation via AbacatePay integration, updating order status automatically.

steps.description: Complete checkout form and initiate payment via AbacatePay.
Verify that a QR Code Pix is generated and displayed to the user.
Simulate payment confirmation webhook from AbacatePay.
Verify that the system updates the order status to paid automatically.
Verify that tickets are issued automatically after payment confirmation.

title: Webhook Processing and Order Reconciliation
description: Verify that incoming webhooks from AbacatePay update orders correctly, handle duplicate or conflicting webhook calls, and reconcile order status properly.

steps.description: Send a payment confirmation webhook with correct order details.
Verify that order status updates to paid and tickets are issued.
Send a duplicate webhook to simulate repeated notifications.
Verify that the system handles duplicate webhook gracefully without adverse effects.
Send a webhook with conflicting or invalid data.
Verify that the system logs the inconsistency and does not corrupt order state.

title: Admin Panel: Product and Stock Management
description: Verify that admins can access admin panels, view product lists, stocks, and update inventory quantities.

steps.description: Login as admin and navigate to the product management panel.
Verify that a complete list of products with stock levels appears.
Modify stock quantity for one or more products.
Verify that stock changes are saved and reflected instantly.
Attempt invalid stock inputs like negative numbers or text.
Verify that input validation prevents invalid stock updates.

title: Admin Panel: Orders and Sales Dashboard
description: Verify that admins can view recent orders, sales performance, and usage statistics in real-time on dedicated dashboards.

steps.description: Login as admin and open recent orders panel.
Verify that recent orders are listed with correct statuses and details.
Navigate to sales overview dashboard.
Verify that sales metrics (total sales, top products, performance trends) are displayed accurately and updating in real-time.
Simulate stock or order changes and verify updates appear in the dashboard without manual refresh.

title: Realtime Synchronization and Offline-First Functionality
description: Verify that data remains consistent across clients in real-time and that the application supports offline usage with synchronization upon reconnection.

steps.description: Open the application in two client instances.
Make data changes (e.g., update cart, add participants) in one client.
Verify that changes are reflected immediately in the other client.
Turn off network access for one client and perform offline actions (add, remove, update items).
Verify that offline changes are queued and reflected locally.
Restore network connection.
Verify that offline changes synchronize correctly with the server and no data conflicts remain.

title: UI Responsiveness Across Devices
description: Verify that the platform UI including Navbar, Footer, modals, and mobile menus render correctly and are functional across desktop and mobile devices.

steps.description: Access the platform on a desktop browser.
Verify that Navbar, Footer, modals, and menus display and behave correctly.
Resize browser window to mobile dimensions or use a mobile device.
Verify that mobile menus open and close correctly and the UI remains usable and visually correct.
Open and interact with modals (product details, email confirmations).
Verify modals open, close, and trap focus as expected.

title: Security: Protected Route Access Control
description: Verify that protected routes require authentication and unauthorized users are redirected to login.

steps.description: Attempt to directly access protected routes without being logged in.
Verify that the user is redirected to the login page.
Login as an authenticated user.
Access protected routes after login.
Verify the user has access to protected routes.

title: Logs and Monitoring Security
description: Verify that application logs and monitoring data do not expose sensitive information like passwords or payment secrets and that logs enable effective diagnostics.

steps.description: Perform operations generating logs (login attempts, payments, product updates).
Check logs for absence of sensitive data such as passwords, payment credentials, or personal private info.
Ensure error logs and monitoring data provide sufficient detail for troubleshooting.

title: Test Coverage Verification for Core Functionalities
description: Verify that unit and integration tests cover all critical flows including authentication, catalog, cart, checkout, payments, admin panels, and realtime synchronization.

steps.description: Run the full test suite including unit and integration tests.
Confirm test coverage reports indicate coverage of authentication, cart management, checkout processes, payment integration, admin management, and realtime features.
Verify no critical functionality remains untested.

title: Error Handling on Failed Payment or Webhook
description: Verify system behavior when payment fails or webhook notifications cannot be processed, including proper user notification and order status management.

steps.description: Simulate a payment failure during checkout.
Verify that the user is notified of payment failure and order status remains pending or failed.
Send a malformed or invalid webhook to the server.
Verify that the server responds gracefully without crashing and logs the error appropriately.
Verify that order status is not incorrectly updated.

title: Checkout Input Validation and Error Messages
description: Verify that all checkout input fields including customer info, participants data, terms acceptance, and additional notes are validated with appropriate error messages displayed for invalid inputs.

steps.description: Navigate to checkout page with items in cart.
Leave mandatory customer fields empty and attempt to proceed.
Verify that validation errors are displayed and user cannot proceed.
Enter invalid email addresses or phone numbers in customer and participant forms.
Verify error messages prompt correction.
Attempt to submit checkout without accepting terms.
Verify that user is prevented from checkout completion with a warning.
